title: Jesus Is Like a Temple to the Righteous
html:
These verses are an admonition from the Lord to Isaiah and others (second- person plural verbal forms are used here) that they should not follow those evil people who continually conspire and are obsessed with fear of war (8:11-12). Rather, Isaiah and his followers should let the Lord "be [their] fear," for he is as a temple, a cornerstone, and sure foundation for those righteous ones who have placed their trust in him.

For the Lord spake thus to me with a strong hand, and instructed me that I should not walk in the way of this people, saying, (8:11)
Say ye not, A [conspiracy],
to all to whom this people shall say, A [conspiracy];
neither fear ye their fear,
nor be afraid. (8:12)
Sanctify the Lord of hosts himself; and let him be your fear,
and let him be your dread. (8:13) And he shall be for a sanctuary;
but for a stone of stumbling and for a rock of offence to both the houses of Israel,
for a [trap] and for a snare to the inhabitants of Jerusalem. (8:14)
And many among them shall stumble, and fall,
and be broken, and be snared, and be taken. (8:15)
